# Bell_et_all_2017

Bell, A., Jones, K. & Fairbrother, M. Understanding and misunderstanding group mean centering: a commentary on Kelley et al.’s dangerous practice. Qual Quant 52, 2031–2036 (2018). https://doi.org/10.1007/s11135-017-0593-5

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Keywords: [stats](../topics/Statistics.qmd), [methods](../topics/Methods.qmd)


-		within and between group effects are distinct, and should not be treated as the same 
-		uncentered models create a weighted average of the between and within effects 
-		group-mean centering reveals the within effect 
-		group-mean centering is a means of isolating and differentiating distinct within and between relationships
-		multilevel models apply group-mean centering
